reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Providing emergency COVID-19 WASH response actions in formal IDP sites in the city of Hasaka

description.narrative:
ue to the worldwide outbreak and pandemic situation for COVID-19 since Febraury 2020, Syria is not an exception and has, is and will be touched to a certain degree. Even though there are only 38 COVID-19 confirmed cases in Syria (15.04.2020) with only 2 deaths so far, we cannot ignore the fact that COVID-19 virus is present and would continue to spread widely and rapidly, if no preventive actions and measures would be implemented. The Government of Syria has put in place movement restrictions and closing of all non-essential businesses all across the country, and is requesting all citizens to respect physical distancing, limit their movements to the essential activities and implement and reinforce relevant hygiene measures such as handwashing with soup, etc.
According to Statistics of Yamamah and the Sub-Relief Committee in Hasaka in the month of April 2020 In North-East Syria (NES), specifically in in Hassakeh Governorate, and IDP-sites exist hosting around 14’250 persons in mostly makeshift accomodations (teAccommodation centers). Persons in these and IDP-sites do not have sufficient living space already, and physical distancing within the accommodation as well as inside t IDP-sites is hardly to completely impossible. Therefore, and based on the reality of having access to limited basic services (WASH, shelter, food, etc.), the risk of potential spreading and potential COVID-19 outbreaks in these areas has to be considered as very high. As health services, not only in IDP-sites, but all over NES area and within Syria are very limited, treatment for COVID-19 patients would be highly challenging and is very limited. Therefore, setting up and running essential COVID-19 prevention actions in general, and particular for WASH, is crucial and indispensable – mainly for IDP-sites, but as well for any other public areas and potentially affected locations, sites, areas and households.
Therefore, Syria Al-Yamama has decided to wanting to be highly involved in the COVID-19 response in Syria, and particularily in NES. has working Syria Al Yamama for hygiene promotion, cleaning activities for communal WASH facilities, garbage collection, and water trucking support , IDP sites and other locations Governorate and will continue and expand the WASH activities .In the following shelters
The target centers for hygiene kits distribution, solid waste management, cleaning of public facilities and maintenance of public facilities (Mahmoud Naef, Hamza ben Abed AlMotaleb,Abed AlRahaman Mahboub,Adwa AlHomosh,Thamer AlNouri,Teysser Khaled Abu AlAswad AlDo'ali, Dhahi AlAli,Tishreen ,Assakan AlShababi,Abu Obeida Ben AlJarah,Veillat,AlBa'ath Haroun Alrasheed,Ibed AlAtheer Neff AlZaed,Sofia ,Tweena ) Centers targeted with awareness-raising activities to prevent from COVID 19
Mahmoud Naef- Abed AlRahaman Mahboub - Hamza ben Abed AlMotaleb- Teysser Khaled - Thamer AlNouri- Awad AlHomosh- Tishreen- Dhahi AlAli- Abu AlAswad AlDo'ali- Veillat- Abu Obeida Ben AlJarah- Assakan AlShababi- Abed AlRazaq AlJohar- AlBa'ath- Haroun Alrasheed- Ibed AlAtheer- Naef AlZaed- Ablahad Mousa - Rufeyda AlAslameyeh - Ahad Sharef Dabbagh - Fawaz Jouli - Labid Ben Rabe'aa - Dhat Annetaqeen Daham Bozo- - Mazeh Hussein - Abdallah AlQaderi - Belal Ben Rabah - Sa'ad Ben Abi Waqass New Khashman -Old Khashman - Mahmoud Issa - Eben Roshd - Halima Assa'adeyeh - Mahmoud Darwesh - Talab AlAzzawi - Shams Addin Hussein - Ismaeel Tpqan-Ahmad Mehkef - AlSha'er Jareer -Jareer AlMosherf -Abed AlAziz AlRashed - Marwan Youssef- AlMothanna - AlAndalos - Naeem Alliji - Sha'aban Jabban - Bor Sa'eed - Fatemeh AlZahra'a - Ahmad Yassen - Hamoud Abed Allah - Salama Alfeyyadh cycle 1 -Salama Alfeyyadh cycle 2,Safia, Tweena Hamza ben Abed AlMotaleb Abed AlRahaman Mahboub Mahmoud Naef
